org.apache.juneau.oapi

Interface OpenApiCommon

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OpenApiParser, OpenApiSerializer

    public interface OpenApiCommon
    Configurable properties common to both the OpenApiSerializer and OpenApiParser classes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String OAPI_collectionFormat
      Configuration property: Default collection format for HTTP parts.
      static String OAPI_format
      Configuration property: Default format for HTTP parts.
      static String PREFIX
      Property prefix.

    • Field Detail

      • PREFIX

        static final String PREFIX
        Property prefix.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OAPI_format

        static final String OAPI_format
        Configuration property: Default format for HTTP parts.
        Property:
        • ID: OAPI_format
        • Name: "OpenApi.format.s"
        • Data type: HttpPartFormat
        • System property: OpenApi.format
        • Environment variable: OPENAPI_FORMAT
        • Default: "NO_FORMAT"
        • Session property: false
        • Annotations:
          • OpenApiConfig.format()
        • Methods:
          • OpenApiSerializerBuilder.format(org.apache.juneau.httppart.HttpPartFormat)
          • OpenApiParserBuilder.format(org.apache.juneau.httppart.HttpPartFormat)
        Description:

        Specifies the format to use for HTTP parts when not otherwise specified via Schema.format().

        Possible values:

        • HttpPartFormat
          • UON - UON notation (e.g. "'foo bar'").
          • INT32 - Signed 32 bits.
          • INT64 - Signed 64 bits.
          • FLOAT - 32-bit floating point number.
          • DOUBLE - 64-bit floating point number.
          • BYTE - BASE-64 encoded characters.
          • BINARY - Hexadecimal encoded octets (e.g. "00FF").
          • BINARY_SPACED - Spaced-separated hexadecimal encoded octets (e.g. "00 FF").
          • DATE - An RFC3339 full-date.
          • DATE_TIME - An RFC3339 date-time.
          • PASSWORD - Used to hint UIs the input needs to be obscured.
          • NO_FORMAT - (default) Not specified.
        Example:

        // Create a plain-text serializer. OpenApiSerializer s1 = OpenApiSerializer .create() .build(); // Create a UON serializer. OpenApiSerializer s2 = OpenApiSerializer .create() .format(UON) .build(); String string = "foo bar"; // Produces: "foo bar" String v1 = s.serialize(string); // Produces: "'foo bar'" String v2 = s2.serialize(string);

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OAPI_collectionFormat

        static final String OAPI_collectionFormat
        Configuration property: Default collection format for HTTP parts.
        Property:
        • ID: OAPI_collectionFormat
        • Name: "OpenApi.format.s"
        • Data type: HttpPartCollectionFormat
        • System property: OpenApi.collectionFormat
        • Environment variable: OPENAPI_COLLECTIONFORMAT
        • Default: "NO_COLLECTION_FORMAT"
        • Session property: false
        • Annotations:
          • OpenApiConfig.collectionFormat()
        • Methods:
          • OpenApiSerializerBuilder.collectionFormat(org.apache.juneau.httppart.HttpPartCollectionFormat)
          • OpenApiParserBuilder.collectionFormat(org.apache.juneau.httppart.HttpPartCollectionFormat)
        Description:

        Specifies the collection format to use for HTTP parts when not otherwise specified via Schema.collectionFormat().

        Possible values:

        • HttpPartFormat
          • CSV - (default) Comma-separated values (e.g. "foo,bar").
          • SSV - Space-separated values (e.g. "foo bar").
          • TSV - Tab-separated values (e.g. "foo\tbar").
          • PIPES - Pipe-separated values (e.g. "foo|bar").
          • MULTI - Corresponds to multiple parameter instances instead of multiple values for a single instance (e.g. "foo=bar&foo=baz").
          • UONC - UON collection notation (e.g. "@(foo,bar)").
        Example:

        // Create a serializer using CSV for collections. OpenApiSerializer s1 = OpenApiSerializer .create() .collectionFormat(CSV) .build(); // Create a serializer using UON for collections. OpenApiSerializer s2 = OpenApiSerializer .create() .collectionFormat(UON) .build(); // An arbitrary data structure. OList l = OList.of( "foo", "bar", OMap.of( "baz", OList.of("qux","true","123") ) ); // Produces: "foo=bar,baz=qux\,true\,123" String v1 = s1.serialize(l) // Produces: "(foo=bar,baz=@(qux,'true','123'))" String v2 = s2.serialize(l)

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
